poem:
**The Edicts of Modern Times**

Through the corridors of power,  
an executive hand scrawls  
futures upon paper,  
steering chariots of steel—  
while wings of fragile nature,  
silenced by a governor's nod,  
fold in quiet retreat.  
In the span of a hundred days,  
whispers of the flu  
find shelter in the margins.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump to sign executive order on car tariffs as he marks 100 days in office – US politics live 4.55pm BST The National Academy of Sciences has canceled a planned workshop on preventing human bird flu infections following instruction from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to stop work on the event, according to Reuters. There have been 70 reported cases of bird flu in the US in the past year, with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
